Description: Magical gem; amulet; limonite; broken suspension loop; engraved on obverse: sainfice of Abraham; on reverse: ankh; inscribed.
Production place: Made in: Egypt (said to come from Karnak)
Bibliographic references: Michel 2001 / Die Magischen Gemmen im Britischen Museum (461)
Spier 2007 / Late Antique and Early Christian Gems (664)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharoahs
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Henry Rider Haggard
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: G469 (Burns Gnostic Gem Number)
Other BM number: OA.9940 (Registration number and/or Big number reinstated in 2023)
